Colombia anounced the health emergency on March 11

Colombia (Bogota) announced yellow alert which is legally binding on both the public and private sectors. Starting tomorrow (12. March), we will issue a decree that will be valid for two months. We are in a mode of changing our daily habits to take care of ourselves and those around us," announced the mayor.

Colombia is colsing the border crossings with Venezuela as a protection measure in view of the situation in the neighbouring country.

description:
Colombia decided to close all land, sea and river borders in the country. Colombia's borders will be closed from 17 March 2020 until 30 May on all passengers.
This border closure will restrict the entry and exit of all national and foreign citizens from the country. During the border closure, cargo transport will be allowed for the entry and exit of products through the authorized land points. 
As of March 16, the entry of non-nationals and non-residents of Colombia into the country is restricted. All Colombian passengers and foreign residents will have mandatory preventive isolation for 14 days.
Colombia is enforcing  restricted entry to any international traveler (all passeners, inclusing colombian natinoals)  to Colombia, regardless of their origin or background starting March 23
Colombia (Cali) is closing the border to Ecuador starting April 22

description: Colombia is enforcing the use of masks for everyone who has simtoms of corona/flu, in the case you have had contact to a confirmed corona case and for medical staff/persons in contact with persons with symptoms at workon Feb. 25.

Colombia is granting life insurance coverage to 585,000 health workers, covering those who die as a result of COVID-19. It is free of charge, no pre-existence, no age limit, no income requirement, and no limit to time of stay. It covers retroactively as of March 2nd until December 31st. It will be administered by FASECOLDA through private insurers.

Colombia announced on March 18 that additional resources areallocated to the health system to facilitate the acquisition of medical equipment, have greater testing capabilities available and provide liquidity resource. 
Accelerate the necessary mechanisms for the implementation of the end point scheme to inject liquidity and pay off historical debts of the health system, guaranteeing the operation of the network and the arrival of the necessary technologies to care for the most critical patients.

description: Colombia has announced that the purchase of the first 1,510 fans for the country was signed. Within the contingency plan to prepare the health system, fans are a very important element. description: Colombia (bogota) the pilot of the 'Por los que nos cuidan' (For those who care for us) program will begin, whose objectives are to offer health workers wellbeing, care and protection by providing them with accommodation close to their workplaces.The program basically consists of using the hotel infrastructure that "is close at some of these places of care for the covid-19" and allowing medical personnel to have access to lodging, food, laundry, and even rest while they are between shifts. Announced on April 15

Colombia announced to  eliminate VAT on the import and sale of 211 medical goods, such as mouthpieces, health equipment and respirators, among others, which are necessary to deal with this pandemic starting April 15

Colombia  announced a Decree under which technical reserves can be used on April 23. This is 1.7 trillion pesos, which will be used to pay debts to hospitals and providers for services and technologies included in the Benefits Plan. The EPSs will distribute the amount of the technical reserves equitably among as many providers and suppliers as possible. They cannot distribute them among their own companies and we will be following up with the Superintendent of Health.

Colombia defined a special support of resources to settle outstanding debts with the health workers in the country.
After identifying the amount of the arrears with health workers under the different contracting modalities in the country, the Government managed to collect the money for the payment of the debts that have been generated from January to March of this year worth $273 billion.

Colombia has announced that two new robots (Hamilton brand) arrived on April 25th at the INS virology laboratory and will be operated after all the necessary tests and formal delivery by the supplier. When they are working simultaneously, they will process around 2,300 samples per day, generating speed and efficiency in the processes.
Colombia is increases its capacity to carry out tests throughout the territory  on May 11

Colombia has implemented the following procedures for domestic flights: Passengers must arrive two hours in advance of their flight's scheduled time with electronic check-up when possible; Passengers must carry only personal bags that can be stored under the passenger's chair, all others must be checked; It will be recommended to make use of the CoronApp-Colombia app to keep health information; Certain airports will have restricted admissions for workers only; All people entering the airport will have their temperature taken with a contactless thermometer; All persons must use personal protective equipment; Passengers arriving at the air terminals for flights should immediately go to the boarding rooms; Workers will clean up all areas; Passenger registration will be taken at the pre-boarding stage; All are required to respect the physical distancing of 2 meters in areas such as counters, scanners and in the queues for aircraft boarding; Boarding will be authorized only when the aircraft is ready; The aircraft will not be serviced on board; Passengers not to use onboard entertainment systems such as screens and mobile phones; Aircraft bathrooms should not be used if possible; Passengers must remain seated during the flight; All airport and airline personnel will be trained to identify biological hazard situations; Passengers given directions for disembarkation; Passengers must go directly to exit; Passengers must report symptoms within 14 days. Starts on July 1st.

In Colombia, the Mandatory Preventive Isolation (quarantine) extends, initially, until May 11. Colombia is enforcing Telework or work from home For working public servants who have recently arrived from a country with an incidence of COVID-19 cases Who have been in contact with patients diagnosed with COVID-19. For those with mild and moderate respiratory symptoms, without abandoning their position
It is important to clarify that each employer is responsible for taking action to this effect and it will be the responsibility of the teleworker to comply with this measure in order to make it effective, in terms of preventive social . Face-to-face meetings or concentration of several people in reduced work spaces with low ventilation, to avoid the risk of contagion of respiratory diseases and COVID-19 by close contact on March 13.

description: Colombia announced a ban on the consumption of alcoholic beverages, crowded meetings staring March 19. That the consumption of intoxicating beverages in open spaces and commercial establishments be prohibited. The sale of intoxicating beverages is NOT prohibited.

Colombia announced that the Attorney General's Office will be firm in enforcing the law to avoid hoarding and price speculation and to take economic advantage of this situation. Whoever incurs in hoarding will be exposed to a penalty of between 4 and 9 years in prison on March 21

Colombia (Cali) is enforcing ley seca (dry law). It is the restriction that limits or prohibits the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages on special days, usually days when there are major scheduled events such as public elections, or when there is a threat of political or sporting unrest that would arouse deep-seated rivalry. Starting April 30 until may 4

Colombia's Ministry of Health and Social Protection implemented biosecurity protocols so that hairdressers, beauty salons, barbershops and related can operate. Scheduled appointments will be required to monitor capacity, customers will need their temperatures taken and must be asked about possible symptoms, a distance of two meters must be maintained between vanities, the use of Personal Protection Equipment is mandatory and employees must be equipped with gowns, head caps, safety goggles, plastic mask and disposable gloves. Disinfectant use is expected, and tools are recommended to be disposable. This goes into effect on June 16th.
Colombia is allowing the reopening of drive-in theaters starting June 18th with social distancing measures in place.

Colombia announced that from March 14 to April 30, 2020 there will be total closure of cultural spaces throughout the country. On the same dates, virtual activities related to the collections and cultural services will be programmed, but not activities in the physical spaces.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Colombia will be allowing the reopening of museums with the following restrictions starting June 16th: virtual payments must be enabled, capacity restrictions must be in place, social distancing must occur, health-related materials or trained staff must communicate recommendations for health and safety upon entry, and hand sanitizer must be available (60% to 90% alcohol).
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description:
Colombia is enforcung that Companies and workplaces should organize work at home for as many employees as possible. For employees who are required to attend the workplace, at least 3 entry and exit shifts should be organised throughout the working day.
In addition to work at home and shift work, universities and colleges should organize the virtualization of as many classes and activities as possible. To postpone any public or private event of massive concentration, of more than 1,000 people, in close contact, that is to say less than 2 meters. All stations and buses in the system will be not only washed but also disinfected daily. Randomly during the day, stations and buses will be disinfected at off-peak hours. All schools and public establishments must wash and disinfect their common areas daily.
 Priority will be given to initial home care of patients infected with COVID19 . This will be done in order to avoid congestion in the health and emergency services and reduce the risk of contagion. The Ministry of Health and the four health sub-networks in Bogotá will organize home delivery of medicines, so that patients with chronic diseases will not have to go to hospitals to pick them up. Public and private health service providers will make joint purchases of mouthwash, gel, alcohol and other supplies to avoid stock-outs and organize adequate distribution.
In Colombia the Ministry of Education authorizes Schools and Universities to use on-line tools until May 30/2020.

Colombia (Bogotá) recommends to cancel every event with more than 500 people. Addtionally, it is recommended to have 1,5m distance between everyone and to realize everything in an open space announced on March 13.
Colombia  announced a ban on meetings and gatherings of more than 50 people on March 19
Colombia is enforcing a ban on meetings and gatherings of more than 50 people
In Colombia (Bogota) the Major restricts the transit of people by gender, on odd days female allowed, and on even days males allowed, effective from April 13 until April 26 (Midnight)

Colombian is enforcing the restriction of activities in the following areas: Bars, nightclubs, casinos, billiards, gambling establishments, gyms, swimming pools, spas, saunas, sports courts/centers, amusement parks and playgrounds. This will last until July 1st starting June 1st.

In the Colombian cultural field, theatres will only be used for creative, artistic activities of the performing arts, without at any time allowing the entry of public or the realization of group activities that generate agglomeration.
Colombian mass public transport cannot exceed an occupancy of 35% of its capacity.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of an annually recurring event

description: Group exercise and sports practice in public places is not allowed. Swimming pools and sports centers can only be used for sports on an individual basis by professional and high performance athletes.
Colombia is enforcing a ban on meetings and gatherings of more than 50 people
